manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Energy Star 18″ Built-In Dishwasher w/Heated Drying SD-9254W (White) or SD-9254SS (Stainless Steel) Description: This built-in 8 place setting smart wash dishwasher is a great addition to any home. At 18 inches wide, this unit takes up minimal space and a great replacement for older appliances. Features 2 pull out dish racks, 6 wash programs and time delay feature. Features a brand new heating function during drying cycle for more effective drying. Time delay feature: allows you to program operation at a later start time (1-24 hours)Error alarm: displays fault codesHeating function during drying cycleRinse aid warning indicator: refill reminder on rinse aid.Stainless steel tubQuite operation: at 52 dbaCapacity: up to 8 standard place settings6 wash programs: normal, heavy, energy, glass, quick, rinseTwo racks: upper and lower racks2 spray arms: for complete cleaning coverageSilverware basket: holds silverware and utensils for easy cleaningAutomatic dispensers: detergent and rinse agent ** Unit is designed for top-mount installation (top-mount brackets included). Side mounting brackets are NOT included. **

Specifications Input voltage 120V / 60Hz Energy consumption 234kWh/yr Water consumption 2.5 - 4.9 gallons Power consumption Wash motor 100W, Heater 700W Noise level (normal) 52dB Drying system Heated drying Unit dimension 17.6″W x 22.6″D x 32.4″H Depth with door fully open 44.5 inches Net weight 54 lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Unbelievable how great this little dishwasher is and this is my second one that I've bought this thing cleans really well there's no food left on or stuck on I never rinse the dishes first and it cleans very well and very happy with it I had a contractor install it it was really easy to install and I'm really enjoying it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little dishwasher
reviews.reviewText: What a great little dishwasher. I just got done with my first wash cycle. Dishes came out bone dry contrary to other reviews. I used the normal cycle and options of high temp and heated dry. I used a cascade tab and filled the rinse aid dispenser with cascade rinse aid. Worked perfectly! Running my 2nd cycle now!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This is a great product if you know what you are doing.
reviews.reviewText: This review is going to cover a bunch of ground.History. About 15 years ago, i bought a compact dishwasher with a big brand name attached. it cost a lot.it's door latch gave out and had to be replaced so i went with an SPT. Having installed and then de-installed the brand name dishwasher, i noticed that, at half the price, the SPT had the exact - and I meanexact - inner workings as the brand name. That SPT lasted about 6 years and the door latch gave out again.The product itself was great but a titchy little connection in the door latch of both machines was the weakspot.So; to the present. New SPT came in, delivered perfectly, packed perfectly.Some enhancements to the previous model - hopefully, the new door latch system will last forever : )Installation for someone who has installed two of them already was pretty straightforward. (other thanthe fact that no installation like this is easy because bending supply lines and twisting wire nuts isalways a pain for - wait for it - a 73 year old )- The instruction manual is not good - verging on bad.. They need a good tech-writer to actually write a manual for novices if they want a novice to be able to tackle the job.If you are going to tackle this job on your own, spend a lot of time looking at the installation book, looking at the machine, making little progressive steps and then go back and try to figure out what the installation manual is trying to tell you. the instructions are the weak spot.I'm hoping the latch problem is fixed because this is a pretty good little dishwasher. And, as said,that old, big name, double price machine had exactly the same innards as this little guy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It doesn’t break which is a miracle for a dishwasher
reviews.reviewText: This is the only brand of dishwasher I trust after a traumatic history of dishwashers breaking for me. Came in pristine condition. We pack it full and it’s a true hero in my kitchen.Edit to add: about a year later, it’s still going strong. I just realized I am supposed to clean the drain of it and it was truly nasty in there after a year! But after some scrubbing and vinegar, it’s good as new.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Looks nice...works so so
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely does NOT dry. Everything is still dripping wet. Tried it on "heated dry" as well as "sanitize." I think those buttons are just decoration. Very disappointing. Washes OK I guess.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very pleased with this unit so far!
reviews.reviewText: This machine does a very good job cleaning dishes. Almost a month into ownership and I’m extremely pleased so far. It’s not noisy however, not quiet either. I’m far more concerned with the job it does. I cannot speak to longevity, that remains to be seen. Also for a small unit, it holds quite a bit of “kitchen-ware”. Easy installation for mildly handy folks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It has a dry feature but it doesn’t work very well. The dishes are always soaked after the cycle

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great diswasher for the price cleans well definitely recommend
